item.title: Virtual Memory and Page Tables: How Operating Systems Manage Memory
item.description:
Every process believes it has the entire machine to itself. It sees a vast, contiguous address space starting from zero, completely isolated from other processes. This illusion is virtual memoryâ€”one of the most important abstractions in computing. Understanding how operating systems and hardware collaborate to maintain this illusion reveals fundamental insights about performance, security, and system design.

1. The Need for Virtual Memory

Before virtual memory, programming was a constant juggling act.
